message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.MM 

This paper proposes a model for 3D human pose estimation using a combination of deep learning and knowledge of human body configuration. The paper focuses on computer vision and machine learning techniques, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. The use of Bi-directional RNNs (BRNN) and the development of a pose sample simulator also suggest that the paper may belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the incorporation of knowledge regarding human body configuration suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The use of a simulator to augment training samples suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.RO (Robotics) sub-category. Finally, the validation of the proposed method on public 3D human pose benchmarks suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category.
